title: I saw people say Dynamic Queue is unfair, but...
body:
I haven't played a single dynamic queue match and only been playing back when only Solo Q and premades were in.

And from what I could get, the critic point is that dynamic queue is unfair because it matches up 5-man premades against 3-man, 2-man or solo players.
But if that is unfair, then how does that make the solo Q before that fairer?
How is a 5-man premade vs a 3-man + 2-man premade less fair than, let's say 3 solo players and a 2-man premade vs a 3-man and a 2-man premade?

The way most people ranked up in League of Legends to Plat and Diamond before was through a duo premade since a duo tended to match up more likely with single solo Q players and your chances for victory with 2 good players would increase dramatically.
If you played solo, your chances were always far lower and your progress just far slower towards your actual rank.

So I don't get what the problem is with this dynamic queue thing.

replies.body:
All this abuse at dynamic queue but i have not noticed anything different. 
I sit at gold 5 (rip stuck) and i haven't noticed any premades try and do something stupid that fails (works in the rare few times it happens). I notice good teamwork by the enemy team whether or not they are in a premade.


I have had no issues :) Love it

Yeah I totally agree.
Solo queue was absolutely infuriating.
Now I can actually get my roles :D

Was never fair for anyone at any point in time even up until this point.

Your rank is not your own because you are not the only player on your team, that is how it always has been. Riot have announced that they have been under serving players who wish to better communicate their individual rank though.

I am hoping they bring out a new system in season 7 that gives players point/loss gain relative to their solo performance in game.

1 .  In old ranked you could only duo, couldn't queue as three, so i think when you said:
"let's say 3 solo players and a 2-man premade vs a 3-man and a 2-man premade?"
You meant 2 2 man premades and a solo player

2 .  It's a lot easier to be coordinated as 5 man than it is as a 2 man + 3 man, granted you could invite randoms into discord or something, even so you're still at a disadvantage as the 5 man has probably played a lot of games together and possibly have more synergy. 

I'm not really too bothered by the new system though as i still mainly duo with my adc or solo, and tbh I haven't felt disadvantaged getting matched vs a 5 man before, but I can see why it could be a potential disadvantage.
